intro: Takhtajaniantha pseudodivaricata, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. The species is notable for its resilience and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
